intro: Euodia waialealae, commonly known as the Hawaiian koa tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is endemic to the island of Hawaii and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the Hawaiian rainforests. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Euodia waialealae is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect this rare botanical species.
